intro: Senecio chicharrensis, commonly known as the Chicharrensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
